In short, the quality of the food here *may* be a little worse than the Castillito on Church (and many other taqueria), and the customers are - for sure - a little worse for wear (ok, some ALOT worse for wear), but that's part of the charm, I suppose.  I've seen some pretty mundane things, some sad things, some uncomfortable things, and - most importantly - some funny things (at least in a cosmic sense) while eating meal at this other Castillito.  I chalk it all up in the name of dinner theater. 

And the green salsa flows delicious.
author: Eric H.

description: Mission burritos are over rated, especially the little castle's, but for what they are, a-okay.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Damn I can't believe I haven't been here before even though I've ridden past here time and time again.  Well today's hangover prompted me to finally stop in and I am kicking myself for not enjoying El Castillito before!

The carne asada here is pretty good - definitely different from Pancho Villa but I'm not quite sure how to describe it other than it is also really tasty so it's not a bad thing.  Not rubbery at all or over done.

You don't get a whole lotta chips with your burrito here but hey I am not here just for chips.  It's pretty clean inside and has a decent amount of seating too.  Nice chill spot for a good solid massive burrito meal!
author: Gene X.

description:
alright food, horrible service. 

some of the most unfriendly resto people ever!
author: Art A.

description:
Standard Mission Burrito. 




Minus the hipster-yuppie-drunken mess just a few blocks down at Cancun.
author: Danyell K.

description:
The neighborhood is way sketchy! And I walk at least once a week through the Tenderloin for pho. That's sayin' a lot people. 

Other than the ambiance outside this place is ok. I had a regular carne asada burrito and it was good. It was gigantic and had a ton of beef. But I kind of wish  it had a little more rice. I know, crazy but I like a balance of everything and not just have it all be meat, meat, meat. But what really made me want to come back? The sandia (watermelon) aguas fresca! So. Good. I'm told that the strawberry one is also excellent. I couldn't tell you as I'm pretty much a one flavor aguas fresca gal. I would brave the sketchiness for this drink.
author: cyndi L.

description:
Working in the Mission till 8 most nights provides some interesting entertainment during my dinner breaks, let me recount a scene from last  nights "dinner theater". 

A lost soul enters El Castillito touting a lab top computer he very well may have swiped from a Yahoo employee getting off their Bio Bus and walks up to the counter to begin his negotiations to sell said lab top for 350 bucks. El Castillito employees, all the while taking orders, council and counter with 150 because the comp has no charger. This causes the seller to get cold feet and stumble out of the restaurant cursing quietly under his breath. 

Now granted the free entertainment was comical/sad, the camarones a la diabla were just plain gross, the refried beans had what looked to be a Kraft single partially melted on top. *barf* Probably won't go here again.
author: Jason H.

description: This is by far my most favorite mexican restaurant. I've been going for years and have never been disappointed, orders are always exact.. til this day they've yet to make a mistake with me. They are very friendly, treat me as a welcome customer and I always look foward to coming again. The prices are definately reasonable as they are never stingy with the portion sizes!! Their place is always very clean and well maintained, even entertaining their guests with a flat screen TV and a big ol' jukebox. (mexican music and tv of course lol) I keep telling them they should market their salsas as they make this chunky red salsa that is so tasty I always grab extra to enjoy it later in another meal. They also serve up the beer and are open quite late, always nice to know they are there most times you are craving delicious mexican food.
author: Onix G.

description: This is best Burrito place in USA. This place still stands the hands of times and Hipsters and Prostitutes. This is a Mission District Landmark. This restaurant is the genesis of the other El Castillito all locations SF.
author: Jay V.

description:
I was in the Mission today for a work appointment and realized I had time to grab a quick lunch beforehand. It was raining so I drove down Mission Street vaguely searching for a "burrito joint." I mean, I love burritos but if you've tasted one you've tasted them all, right? 

WRONG!!!!!

At Taqueria El Castillito they grill your tortilla and the meat you order right in front of you, so it's fresh. From the first bite I knew this burrito was different. It was so flavorful and juicy! The next time I'm craving Mexican food I will be heading here, even though I don't live in the neighborhood.

Great job, El Castillito!!!
author: Tim G.

description: Discloser: I am a taqueria junkie. One thing that is a taqueria truism is that the locations tend to vary in quality over time. This one is no exception. They have a line cook who is there now, but sometimes returns to his home in Mexico. When he is there, the food is top notch. When he is in Mexico, go somewhere else. I believe his name is Giulio (sp?). If you are the owner of Taqueria El Castillito, realize what makes your place. Although the remodel is welcomed as well. They also have a killer jukebox and good salsas.
author: Richard C.

description: Their al pastor tastes like char siu.  Not saying that's good or bad, but it was unexpected.  However, the burritos are tightly wrapped and their fillings are piping hot and evenly distributed when served.  The Beans and rice are unspectacular.
author: Suo L.

description: El Castillito makes both the vegetarian and non-vegetarian in the party happy. Went mid-day, so I can't speak to the noise,  but the veggie burrito was way better than El Farralito's  (yay avocado on the "regular"!) and they actually had a non-scary food safety score. That was a refreshing surprise compared to several of its Mission competitors.
author: Silent A.

description:
I had the vegetarian burrito with no rice and it was the BEST one I've ever had. SO damn good! I will be back and I will be ordering the same thing.

(I did get a bit of a gassy feeling from this later that night, but nothing earth shattering) (ha HA, get it?)
author: Kandy P.

description: I have eaten here more than any place in the city.  The Tacos are great, i recommend the El Pastor that is done on a vertical rotisserie.  Also the Torta's are great too.
author: Shawn L.

description: Good, cheap fare. I had the "wet" burrito with chicken. It came with a rich, smokey, mole-style sauce. El Castillito also has 4 kinds of sauces up for grabs; the two I tried were very good.
author: Adam B.

description: Eh. Was super hungry tonight, and didn't want to walk too far. So, I decided to give it a try. Order carnegie asana super nachos and they were OK. I've had much better. Next time, I won't be so lazy.
author: Selena G.

description:
I was too drunk in the wee hours of the night to find my fave taqueria (El Farolito) and I somehow got dropped off here by yellow cab driver who misunderstood me.   

After finding myself in a shady neighborhood, and partially due to laziness, I decided to stay and check it out.  It couldn't be that bad right?  Well . . . lets just say it was not good and the insanity that goes on right outside the place late at night is a slight deterrent.   Certainly no El Farolito.  On the upside, the employees were very friendly, and, if you are not a connoisseur of Mexican food, you might be more jazzed about it than I was.
author: Brenna C.

description:
literally walked ten blocks in heels to come to this hole-in-the-wall...for super nachos I could not finish with one other person.

could hardly walk to the BART station afterwards. you are forewarned.
author: Serena W.

description: I stumbled upon Taqueria Castillo in the Mission completely by happenstance. My roommate and I had a strong hankering for Burritos and like all San Francisco Residents we knew the best place was the mission. Taqueria Castillo is located a block up from the 16th and Mission Bart Station, heading south on Mission. The burritos were quite fantastic, the service was quick and helpful and the restaurant overall was very clean. It was definitely an enjoyable evening, and I even found myself outside the Taqueria under the same name on Turk Street, hoping it would be as good... Just FYI It's not, you need to head to the horses mouth.
author: Mark C.

description: I enjoyed my super chicken quesadilla very much... I wouldn't mind coming here to try their super burrito and tacos.. this place was opened after 10 and I'm glad we found this place!
author: Tram N.

description: EXCELLENT chicken quesadilla, loved the sauce it was marinated in- quick friendly serve too.
author: Julie Z.

description:
when Bacon Dog Cart is elsewhere in the 'hood,
but you are seriously craving some post-dancing food
and your drunk friends are, for cheese, in the mood
then El Castillito'll do you kids nuthin but good.

that quesadilla may potentially make you think twice
in the morning, but for now it's 100% nice.
the salsa bar has some serious spice...
y'know, i may have just found a new favorite vice.
author: Rachel S.

description: I went into Castillito today for the first time and ordered their Quesadilla Castillito. It was sort of like a cross between a burrito and a quesadilla--more round than your standard Mission quesadilla, but more focused on the meat, cheese, and sour cream.   I usually go to La Taqueria for tacos, El Farolito for burritos, and Cancun for quesadillas, so it was intriguing to have a new option. I might not come too often, though, because there was a little too much sour cream for my taste and I wasn't keen on their salsa roja, which tasted like a can of tomatoes to me.
author: George L.

description:
good burrito for under $5. that green salsa was good and i don't usually eat the green. typical pico de gallo with cilantro, and a red with cilantro. 

it is true they put the tortilla on a griddle instead of steaming them but then they wrap in aluminum foil which effectively ends up steaming them anyway. it was a good filling burrito and will eat there again but not until i try all the others in the 'hood. and that could take awhile. there is just so much great food in this city and in the mission particularly. but damn i can't find that gyro.

for the folks concerned about the crack whores and meth addicts that this neighborhood has no shortage of. it takes the two of you to fuck the whore so that's your call and the same goes with the drugs being used and abused. so unless you fear you might fall off the whore and/or drug wagon you should be okay eating here. day or night.
author: roger b.

description: Better than Cancun down the street. Conveniently located next to the porn store. Back when I lived in la mision, I would have passed it up to go to Farolito or Pancho Villa, but now that I live in the land of shit burritos (aka upper haight) (ps - is it so freaking hard to grill a tortilla, people?), I fantasize about my Castillito burrito that i always pick up before the long and exhausting wait for the 33 stanyan to take me home. And they put cilantro in their burritos. I love cilantro.
author: Maria D.

description: I had a lot of hesitation going in here because of the shady people that tend to order here when I walk by late at night.  The first time I went in, I had a veg burrito and it was cheap and did the trick.  A few weeks later, I ordered the veg quesadilla and it was incred.  They make it in the traditional way and then they roll it like a burrito and grill it some more.  And for under $4, you couldn't ask for a better deal.
author: A K.

description: I didn't really mind, because by principle I'm an indiscriminate omnivore, but last night there was a huge piece of steak in my vegetarian burrito.
author: Eric M.

description:
I'm so conflicted!

One time there was a bumble bee head in my burrito.

Another time I saw a pimp walk in with two prostitutes (one per arm) and buy drugs from the counter.

But the food is so good!  5!
author: Andrew G.

description: Their carnitas super burrito is fantastic.  I crave it.  The chicken quesadilla is also really solid.  I get that when I'm not craving too much rice.
author: Courtney N.

description:
I've already established that people who prefer the puny Casa Mexicana over the mighty El Castillito are retarded.  I hope that they get the occupational therapy that they need to use a fork and knife to cut their burritos without getting hot refried beans on their crotches.  No I don't.

You know what?  I'm glad this world is full of misguided idiots who don't understand food.  Stay away from the best burrito in SF and keep mobbing El Farolito and Pancho Villa  Bring your silverware to Papalote.  I don't care to educate you.  I'm posting for my El Castillio friends to thank them.  

Thank you for your high quality meats that you aren't afraid to display and crisp up right in front of me.  Thank you for the freshest vegetables at any taqueria in SF, chopped and sliced continually throughout the night and never frozen.  Thank you for grilling and not steaming my burrito tortilla!  Hardly anyone else does this!  AND fresh avocado, scooped right when I want it.  All this, and fresh horchata or cane sugar Coke, from Mexico.  Thank you.
author: Sarah E.

description: My experience at this Castillito did not compare anywhere near to the Castillito by Safeway at Church & Market. The quesadilla I got was more expensive and also nearly inedible, mostly full of sour cream. They didn't ask if I wanted jalapenos or anything like that and did not seem to possess the culinary excellence I was getting at the other location. Place was also empty. Just a really poor experience. I would never go back.
author: Karl N.

description: Kinda smelled like a bathroom but it's gonna take more than that to keep me from a pastor burrito. Whole pieces of avocado and a griddled tortilla make all the difference to a burrito gourmand such as myself. Crackheads and a sex shop just outside the door. Just putting that out there.
author: Josua P.

description:
following the advice of yelp (as well as the delicious aroma of mexican food, as i only live a couple of blocks away), i tried el castillito with my girlfriend. 

when we first got there, i was surprised at the minimalist decor, but considered it a part of their charm. i was again surprised about the prices (just a few dollars more than what i would have expected), but then was satisfied when i saw the size of the portions. 

when we took it home, it was delicious and really hit the spot. but then again later, i had second thoughts once again, as i suddenly felt really really greasy.

in one sentence, el castillito is another / the best? greasy mexican restaurant in the mission. 
---and probably the best fuckin' drunk mexican place in the city. maybe.
author: Tara T.

description: El Castillito offers a good, cheap vegetarian burrito with actual chunks of avocado, which is always a plus.  There's nothing too fantastic about this place, but it very well may be the cheapest burrito in the area.  If you can't handle the extra block of sketchiness to get to Cancun, El Castillito will do you nicely.
author: Kevin H.

description: A real hole and a gem ... love everything on their menu, esp. the beef fajita dinner plate, which they make freshly for you!  The price is great, and the staff is very friendly.
author: S. I.

description:
Rushed in for a carnitas burrito after Can't Stop the Serenity at the Victorian Theater.  Gobbled a little then took the rest to go and headed off to 16th St BART. 

Made it to 12th St Oakland before it came back up the way it went down.  Nothing like a late-night barf in a bart station to cap off a great evening with friends.  At least I had the takeout bag to use.  

FWIW, the burrito itself tasted great going down, not so much coming up.
author: Jessica G.

description: Sexy Burrito Mojado.  Pssst . . . their secret ingredient has so got to be cinnamon and it definitely works.  No need to be stoned, but you will be able to eat more of their giant servings.  Everything was great and there is an internet based jukebox - who could ask for mas?
author: Lauren G.

description:
There are much better burritos in the Mission.

And despite the business description, they do NOT accept credit cards.
author: Eric D.

description: This is a good burrito spot with very nice staff. I enjoyed a Super Carne Asada Burrito and came up short of finishing it as this thing had some serious girth. The foil wrap was excellent and the burrito was rolled tight. Each bite had a mix of all the ingredients and it was very enjoyable. The immediate neighborhood is another story, I managed to enjoy my meal despite a police situation with some local problem starters right out the front door, which seemed like a regular situation given I was the only one who stopped motor boating their burrito to watch. Come here also for their breakfast burrito, arguably one of the better breakfast slabs in San Francisco, be sure to get the Chorizo.
author: Michael G.

description: I have only been to this taqueria in the middle of the night so the crowd is a little rough in this case, but all you have to do is pump in a few dollars on the jukebox and play some Morrissey. Trust me. ALL INVOLVED are then ironically smiling and swaying to the music. Works like a charm EVERY TIME. Beyond that, this is my all time FAVORITE BURRITO IN THE WORLD.  Yes, you heard me, THE WORLD. Just as everyone else has stated, they grill their tortillas which is a total bonus. My favorite things about my staple veggie burrito - no rice order is the FLAVOR. There is plenty of cilantro, onions, cheese and CHUNKS of avocado!  Mmmmm!!  I prefer refried beans and they are available on request. Otherwise you get the stock whole pinto beans. A little warning: watch out for flailing juices mid-burrito. They usually run white from the sour cream and when it falls on the front of your black skirt... it's just wrong. I live on the East Bay but will bridge & tunnel and hooker dodge it in a heartbeat if it means getting to eat one of these burritos on a regular basis.
author: Julie J.

description: Although it's in a sketchy area, if you're looking for cheap and quick Mexican food, then this place will probably fit the bill.
author: Naomi N.

description:
Excellent pollo asada. The salsa was so-so. But the tortillas and meat were excellent. 

A well-balanced burrito and speedy service were why I gave it 4*.
author: Rahul T.

description:
i love this place! excellent veggie burritos. the service is fast, and they have lime wedges at the salsa bar.
plus the guy serving me had a weed leaf on his hat. so plus star.
author: Becca M.

description: id give this place NO STARS but since i cant ill do one cause im nice.....DONT put discount cupons in places like the Bay Guardian if you know its past the expiration date......since you didnt want to honor the cupon out of good customer service i left and took my $$$ and buisness elsewhere........maybe thats why this place is always empty when i walk by and Pancho Villas is always packed i dont know........
author: Jeff M.

description: Enough about the neighborhood - - so go in the morning, already.  I happen to have business in the neighborhood every other Weds morning.  Castillito opens at 10:00, when the area is pretty cleared out.  What's happening outside the establishment at that hour adds color to the experience, but not enough to scare me away.  The staff are adorable people, really sweet.  The carnitas burrito is my favorite thing in the world for a late breakfast.  And that creamy guac - how do they do that?  I want the recipe.
author: Judith P.

description: I've been going to El Castillito for over a dozen years and have never been let down. Their salsa bar is great from green to hot. They aren't as busy as some of the better known places in the area so you'll seldom have to wait. Less than a block form 16th Street BART.
author: Dan L.

description:
Last few times I have been here it has sucked. A weak burrito with no flavor (and not to mention about 5 bucks, which I don't mind paying if it is big) and some terrible nachos. The nachos were small, not much cheese, too much lettuce and tomatoes, and black beans. I was not happy.

I'm a big fan of jainty cheap mexican food but I won't come back here
author: Joseph B.

description: This place has bomb super burritos.  However, a chicken super burrito here will now set you back about $8, without a drink.  Yeah, all the reviews about the sketchiness surrounding the restaurant are true.  First time I went here about 5 or 6 years ago, I witnessed this as one deranged crackhead was whacking another with his wooden cane just outside the door (and these weren't "love taps").  Nobody then seemed at all bothered by this, choosing instead to continue munching, and if you leave these folks alone to their demons, they'll usually leave you alone too.  I came here a few days ago, and the workers were making food for their buddies out of turn which was a little let down, but my burrito and strawberry aqua fresca ($3.29 lg) were the bomb.  Read the posted menus carefully, as they might put different ingredients in their burritos than you're used to.  Example: sliced avocados (which I actually love!)  The free chips that they give you with each order taste of the bagged variety, but they do provide a sauce-veggie counter with excellent sauces.  Compare this place to Papalote's for example that charges 2 or 3x more for the same burrito and it's a no brainer to come here.
author: Darrin K.

description: i thought the quesadilla was a bit over-priced, but when i got home after a drunken night, i could only eat half! they definately give you good bang for your buck, and it was very tasty as well. they even threw in some chips and had pre-packaged salsa. there are a couple other locations in the city. this will definately be another option if im in the mood for mexican.
author: Andrew T.

description: $4.93, tax included, got me three meals.  Yes, my veggie burrito was that big.
author: S P.

description: i have to say this place was good! i usually went there for lunch with friends.. But bsides that this place has great food at a low budget! i went to the cosmo school across the street. but i stop going there cause of the workers.. so - a star for the service..
author: Silvia C.

description: best goddamn torta in the city... i kid you not.
author: mm ..

description:
ever get your burrito and shout "OH SHIT!"? no of course you havnt. its a burrito right? fucking WRONG.
i ordered the "wet burrito"  and it was given to me in a BOX not the traditional foil ive grown up with. naturally i thought this was not my order and after about 40 seconds of doing my "confused look around the room and roll my eyes" dance i realized it Was my food. i take it to the table, where my lovely GF is waiting, and i crack the lid open.
immediately my jaw drops. literally. i let out a "GUHHH!" slam the lid shut and turn to my girl with the same goofy face. wait. she didnt look goofy and go guhhh too, im saying i showed her MY guh face.
anyway.
the burriton, HAHA i mean burrito...i like burriton, sounds medieval.... was the classic shape of a burrito, but beefed up to twice as large. doused in a chipotle sauce and melted cheese and sliced avocado. 
cost about. 6 to 7 bucks? now i NEVER take my burritos to go. i finish those shits in minutes. but this burrito, this motherfucking burrito! i had to use a fork and knife! i had to take half of it home! i just could NOT finish the beast in one swoop. 
had a TASTY horchata to wash it down with. 9 bucks total.
the horchata was some of the best ive had.
nice workers too.
please check it out.
its dirt cheap and uh...gold tasty? whats the opposite of dirt? its not gold thats for sure!
author: Spencer P.

description: The unique Quesadilla Castellito (basically a grilled burrito without the rice and beans and with more meeeeeat) is tasty as are the Alambres --- a mixture of carne asada, bacon, green peppers, onions, served with sides of beans, rice, and tortillas.  Drawback:  Lotsa small-time crack and smack dealers and disgusting disease-infested whores just outside this place at night can ruin your appetite.
author: David M.
